document_title: Benign kidney tumors: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: u-than-lanh-tinh.json_0_What is a benign kidney tumor?
subsection_content:
Benign kidney tumor is a condition in which the tumor forms and grows in the kidney, but is unable to metastasize to other parts of the body. Sometimes, the size of the tumor can grow, pressing on nearby internal organs and tissues. (first)
Benign growths are very common and can form anywhere in the human body. When discovered, they can cause anxiety and fear. However, the fortunate thing is that most tumors are benign.
Any of us can develop a benign tumor, including children. However, statistical results show that older people are more likely to develop tumors than other groups.
The tumor forms and grows in the kidney, but is unable to metastasize to other organs.
